Summary: Flashing object, irregular flight pattern; not airliner, not star.
Object Flight Path: Hovering then path,Path with directional change
divs: sighting detailsthis is an entirely true sighting. i am not exaggerating any parts, and i am giving the best record of the incident even though it happened four years ago. june 23, 2005 western pennsylvania around midnight, possibly even a little into the next morning my friend k (i will call her k for now, as i am unsure whether or not she would prefer to be named) had a bonfire that night. it was a summer night before our senior year in highschool, and the skies were clear. there was no alcohol nor any mind-altering substance at the bonfire. most everyone had left, and k and i were left to tend to the fire, and we were just star-gazing and relaxing. we both noticed a light in the sky. it was circular\spherical, high in the air above us, and it was pulsating. because of how high in the air the object appeared, it was impossible to tell how big it really was. you could tell that it was not a star, and it was, in fact, within our atmosphere. it was not stationary like a star, and it did not follow a set trajectory like a shooting\falling star. i could tell that it was not an airliner because of the way that airliner's light up with three blinks, and this object only had one on-going pulsation. instead, as the object flashed, it moved in an irregular pattern. i would describe the flight pattern as almost a random zig-zag: not a fixed back-and forth motion. the angles that this object moved on were too acute to be executed by any aircraft that i have ever seen. this went on for probably two minutes or so, the object pulsating and moving irregularly, before it finally disappeared. i considered everything it could be. yet, i was able to immediately rule out an airliner or shooting star, or even a stationary star. i also considered it to be a lightning bug, but then again the object was definitely too high up and too large to be an insect. although before i said it was "impossible" to tell how large the ufo was, i know that it was too large to be a lightning bug - the emphasis is that it was a bigger object. k and i both witnessed this incident, and every time i ask her if we really saw it, she confirms my second-guessing. once you see something unbelievable it is natural to question your own credibility. i did not feel threatened or intimidated by the object. it did not seem to be aware of us watching it, as it was high in the sky, and it did not seem to want to use any camoflauge besides the cover of darkness at night. if anything, i was and still am curious to discover what it was, and if it really was an et craft.
trends: There has been one other sighting in Sharpsville
There were no other sightings in Sharpsville on or around June 23rd 2005
